pageContext.claim: “We are now averaging 60,000 illegal and inadmissible aliens a month on our Southern Border.”
pageContext.analysis: The rate is accurate looking at the last several months. But Trump misleadingly combines two different numbers reported monthly by U.S. Customs and Border Protection. He's adding up the people caught trying to cross the border illegally (apprehensions) with the people who request asylum or show up legally at ports of entry (inadmisibles). Inadmisibles are not illegal immigrants because there is no illegality involved. If Trump used only the number of apprehensions, the total for fiscal 2018 would be 1,000 a day, or half what he claimed. He's also twisting the data to brag about how high the apprehensions are, whereas he used to brag how much they had fallen.
